metadata.title: GEOSAT Land/Ice Geophysical Data Records
metadata.description: GEOSAT Geophysical Data Records (GDR) - (Raw altimeter data merged with Navy Astronauts Group (NAG) ephemerides, corrected for path-length effects due to troposphere and ionosphere) cover approximately 24 hours each (14 or 15 complete revolutions) beginning and ending as close as possible to 72Â° north (maximum latitude). GDR's are similar to SEASAT and GEOS-3, but include full 10  per second data as well as 1 second averages. GDR's collected over land ice, as well as GDR's over ocean but flagged as "bad" are archived on a separate tape from the ocean GDR's.  These land/ice  GDR's are useful when combined with GEOSAT waveform data records (WDR's).  Altimeter often fails to re-acquire lock when it moves from land or ice to ocean. GDR's contain sea surface height, geoid height, significant wave height, height offset for over land or over ice, solid/fluid tide and wet/dry troposphere corrections, ionosphere correction, and flags indicating reasons for quality test failures.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: To merge raw altimeter data with Navy Astronauts Group (NAG) ephemerides, corrected for path-length effects due to troposphere and ionosphere.

Status: Complete

Maintenance frequency: Unknown

Access constraints: Exact repeat mission began on 8 November 1986; land/ice GDR's are currently available through December 31, 1989.

Use constraints: None

Distribution liability: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
